availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John L. Powell (Livingston County, KY, merchant)

body.p: Livingston County, Kentucky, merchant. Shelby County, Kentucky, native. Married to Naomi N. Powell. Father of Edwin W. Powell, William T. Powell, Martha E. Powell, Martin N. Powell, and Mary A. Powell. Merchant in Livingston County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Livingston County in 1860. Employed James F. Powell as a salesman in Livingston County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, Smithland, p. 277.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, Division 3, p. 367A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken County, Paducah, Subdivision 112, p. 154A.
"Old Citizen Dead," The Paducah Sun (Paducah, Kentucky), November 23, 1903, p. 1.
